quadratic-equation.title: Quadratic Equation
quadratic-equation.text: A quadratic equation is an equation that contains a single variable of degree 2. It is often written as ax2+bx+c=0, where x is a variable, a, b and c are numbers, and a≠0.

linear-function.title: Linear Function
linear-function.text: A linear function is a function whose graph is a straight line. It can be defined as fx=mx+c, where m is the slope of the line, and c is its y-axis intercept.

quadratic-function.title: Quadratic Function
quadratic-function.text: A quadratic function is a function of the form fx=ax2+bx+c, where a, b, and c are numbers, and a≠0. The graph of a quadratic function is a U-shaped curve called a parabola.

parabola.title: Parabola
parabola.text: A parabola is the shape of the graph of a quadratic function like y=x2. It is symmetric, U-shaped and can point either upwards or downwards. It is also a conic section.

linear-equation.title: Linear Equation
linear-equation.text: A linear equation is of the form ax+b=0, where x is a variable, and a and b are numbers. When graphed in a coordinate system, the values of ax+b form a straight line.

variable.title: Variable
variable.text: A variable is a quantity that is unknown or may change value. In an algebraic expression, it is usually represented by a letter like x.
